description.p: At 2nd level, You gain proficency with the Nature skill if you do not already have so and when you roll a Wisdom(Nature) check you can add your Wisdom modifier to the total.

sheet.description: When you roll a Nature check you can add {{wisdom:modifier}} to the total.

description.p: Additionally at 2nd level, your connection to the land allows you to draw from natural life energy and create a blessed field. When you expend one use of your Wild Shape you can instead of transforming your own body, you can instead create a blessed field 15ft in diameter within 30ft of yourself for 1 minute. While inside your blessed field you gain +1 to AC and when you heal a creature inside the field with your druid spells they gain additional hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier. Additionally, when outside your field and you take damage, as a reaction, you can teleport to the centre of your blessed field. You can only have 1 blessed field active at a time. The Blessed Field appears as consecrated to divination magic.

description.p: At 6th level, during a short rest, you can conjure up or bless a meal to share with up to 5 companions. When you use this feature you choose one effect from the list below. Once you have used this feature you cannot use it again till you have finished a long rest.

ul.li: Have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned for the next hour.
Have the spell Remove Curse be cast on you without using a spell slot.

sheet.description: During a short rest, you can conjure up or bless a meal to share with up to 5 companions. When you use this feature you choose one effect from the following. Recover from 1 level of exhaustion. Have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned for the next hour. Heal 3d6 hit points. Have the spell Remove Curse be cast on you without using a spell slot.

description.p: At 10th level, at the dawn of each day, you roll 1d4 and gain that many Harvest Sprites. Harvest sprites are small beings created from you well of energy. They are 3 inches in height, are able to carry up to 10 pounds in weight, have a movement speed equal to your own movement speed and you can telepathically communicate with your harvest sprites. Harvest sprites can convey basic information back to you (feelings/denial/confirmation) and are able to convey simple messages (one sentence). You can use your action to cause your harvest sprites to deliver your touch spells as long as that spell does not cause direct damage. This will cause the harvest sprite that used the spell to disappear. While in contact with you or a willing ally you can use your reaction to teleport yourself or your ally to the centre of your blessed field this causes that harvest sprite to disappear.

description.p: At 14th level, you have ascended to a higher form of power. The well of natural energy within you has given birth to a new demiplane of your own design. This takes form as a field 300 ft squared surrounded by impassable hills with a two-story wooden cottage in the field although this is up to the player’s discretion as long as no features within cause damage. Inside you can instantaneously grow any food-bearing plants that provide full sustenance for any who eat the fruit and you can create any non-magical object that you have seen before that fits within the homestead but it cannot cause damage and you can replicate any sort of weather that you have seen. You spend 10 minutes gathering nature’s energy into yourself and form the pocket dimension outside of which takes the form of a translucent sphere about 5 feet in diameter. Only people you choose can see the entrance; those who you do not allow must make a Perception check against your spell save DC to perceive the entrance; those who fail cannot see or interact with it and if their passive perception is higher than your spell save DC they can see the entrance automatically. Creatures my repeat this saving throw each day. When a hostile creature attempts to enter they must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, on a failure you become alerted to their presence and can discern where they are while in the homestead and cannot be hidden by magical means bar a wish spell. You can as an action you can attempt to banish any creature within your homestead, this targeted creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or immediately be banished outside your homestead for the duration of your current homestead. This lasts for 12 hours.

As an action, while you have your blessed field active you can spend 1 use of your Wild Shape to create an incomplete version of your homestead. Any hostile creatures within your blessed field when you activate this ability must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be pushed outside the range of your blessed field and takes 2d8 plus your Wisdom modifier radiant damage. On a success, they remain within your homestead but any time a creature takes damage they take bonus damage equal to your Wisdom modifier and must repeat the save if they take any damage. To see into the homestead a creature must pass a perception check equal to your spell save DC.
